node.title: Couple separated by border closures renew wedding vows in video call minutes before husband dies
node.alt: A Fijian couple smile in a selfie, surrounded by greenery.
node.description: Iva was on a train to work in Sydney when she renewed her wedding vows to her dying husband in Fiji. Five minutes later, he took his last breath.
node.content:
["Five minutes after they renewed their wedding vows\u00a0over a video call, Iva Qounadovu's husband Apenisa Uluirewa\u00a0took his final breath.\u00a0", "She was catching the train to work in Sydney on a Monday morning, surrounded by strangers, and he was lying in bed, thousands of kilometres away in Fiji, with close relatives by his side.", "The couple were formally\u00a0married in a\u00a0civil ceremony in Fiji in 2019, just before Ms Qounadovu\u00a0moved to Australia, but it\u00a0was important to them to have their wedding\u00a0in a church.", "Just a few days before\u00a0Mr\u00a0Uluirewa's passing, the couple had been chatting on the phone, planning their dream wedding\u00a0ceremony at a cathedral in Parramatta.", "\"Every time I went past the church, I would take a photo and send it to him,\"\u00a0Ms Qounadovu told the ABC's\u00a0Pacific Beat\u00a0program.", "", "
Ms\u00a0Qounadovu has not been able to visit her young son in Fiji due to uncertainty around travel\u00a0between Australia and Fiji.(Supplied:\u00a0Iva Qounadovu)
", "They had even started buying decorations for the big day \u2014 waiting patiently for international borders to open up.\u00a0", "\"It was going to be a small Fijian wedding, but it was going to be so special as we were [planning to have] it here in Australia,\" she said.\u00a0", "Ms Qounadovu moved to Sydney in October 2019 to study and became separated from her husband and their 11-year-old son when the pandemic hit.\u00a0", "After almost two years apart, things were starting to look positive with talk of a travel bubble between the countries.", "Then, in September this year, Mr\u00a0Uluirewa was diagnosed with stage-four\u00a0colorectal cancer.\u00a0", "There was nothing the doctors could do and he was sent home with palliative care.", "As his health started to deteriorate rapidly, their hopes of seeing each other again were shattered.\u00a0", "Travelling to Fiji wasn't an option either: there were no flights and even if she could get there, Ms Qounadovu would have to quarantine for two weeks \u2014 time her husband didn't have.\u00a0", "", "
The couple had been planning their dream wedding\u00a0ceremony before Mr\u00a0Qounadovu was diagnosed with cancer.(Supplied:\u00a0Iva Qounadovu)
", "So, the pair decided to have their wedding ceremony over a video call.\u00a0", "\"We asked the priest to come over the next day,\" Ms Qounadovu said.\u00a0", "\"It was held in a bedroom. He was sitting on the bed. And they just prepared the altar next to it.\"", "The couple renewed their\u00a0vows and then Mr Qounadovu asked a relative to move the camera closer to him.\u00a0", "\"I could tell he was in pain,\" Ms Qounadovu said.\u00a0", "Mr Uluirewa died five\u00a0days after his diagnosis.", "As Ms Qounadovu\u00a0processes her grief, she is\u00a0desperate to fly back to Fiji to collect her son and bring him back to Sydney, so she can continue to study and work.\u00a0", "But if she leaves Australia, there's little certainty about when she will be able to return.", "Fully vaccinated Australian citizens are now able to fly overseas and return to some states, but the path for non-citizens to enter or return to the country is more difficult.", "Home Affairs Minister Karen Andrews said Australia was working on easing restrictions for other cohorts.\u00a0", "\"Temporary visa holders can be assured that we're working on this as a priority,\" she said.\u00a0", "Ultimately, it is\u00a0a matter for state governments to decided on who can and cannot come in \u2014 and each has slightly different rules.", "New South Wales will begin accepting international students back into the county in\u00a0December, but the numbers are tightly capped at 250 per fortnight.\u00a0", "Only students from certain countries will be allowed in, with Fiji not included, according the\u00a0NSW government.\u00a0", "Ms Qounadovu said she hoped that would change.\u00a0", "\"Our hopes and dreams as a family don't stop here ... this is just a detour we have to make,\" she said.\u00a0", "
'She's in tears'
", "It is\u00a0a predicament shared by Papua New Guinea citizen, John Duhube, who has been separated from his Australian partner since March last year.\u00a0", "The couple met in 2013 when she was hiking the Kokoda trail and he was working as a tour guide.\u00a0", "", "
Mr Duhube worries Western Australia won't allow Papua New Guineans to visit any time soon.(Supplied:\u00a0John Duhube)
", "But with her in Western Australia and him in PNG, they have\u00a0been waiting for borders to reopen to reunite.", "\"I don't know when I can travel back to Australia ... it's very hard for me,\" Mr Duhube said.", "He worries Western Australia will not\u00a0allow Papua New Guineans to visit any time soon due to the country's low vaccination rate and high number of COVID-19 cases.\u00a0", "", "
Mr\u00a0Duhube is concerned that COVID situation in Papua New Guinea will further delay a reunion with his partner in Australia.(Supplied:\u00a0John Duhube)
", "But others are more positive.\u00a0", "Australian Tourism Industry Council chair Evan Hall told the ABC he expected fully vaccinated foreign nationals to be able to travel to all Australian states and territories without having to quarantine by mid-February 2022.\u00a0", "For some states, that may happen even sooner.", "\"It really does depend on when the Australian government opens up international arrivals for the various visa classes for foreign nationals,\" Mr Hall said.\u00a0", "\"On behalf of all of Australia, we can't wait to see our guests come in from overseas.", "\"It's been a bit of a long wait.\"", "PNG's national airline, Air Niugini, last week announced special flights from Port Moresby to Sydney due to high demand.\u00a0", "\"Travel is initially limited to Australian citizens, permanent residents and special visa holders. We do expect this to extend to business travellers and tourists soon after,\" the airline said in a statement.", "The first tourist flights to Fiji will also begin on December 1.", "", "
COVID cases surging across several European countries
"]
